meanings.definition: To assume or suggest the existence or truth of something
meanings.sent1: She was positing that the missing keys were in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The scientist is positing a new theory about the origin of the universe.
meanings.sent3: By positing that aliens had taken her socks, she made her friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: He was positing a bold idea that challenged the traditional beliefs.
meanings.sent5: Positing the presence of ghosts in the old house made the story more exciting.

meanings.definition: The act of placing or setting something in a particular position or place
meanings.sent1: The careful positing of the vase on the shelf prevented it from falling.
meanings.sent2: His positing of the books on the table made the room look tidy.
meanings.sent3: The positing of the cake on the highest shelf kept it away from the curious dog.
meanings.sent4: The positing of the sign at the entrance guided visitors to the right direction.
meanings.sent5: Her positing of the painting in the center of the room drew everyone's attention.
